summary: This is an amended complaint filed by Virginia Giuffre against Alan Dershowitz in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York. The complaint alleges Dershowitz sexually abused Giuffre when she was a minor, participated in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking scheme, and subsequently engaged in a campaign of defamation against her. It details numerous public statements by Dershowitz denying the allegations and accusing Giuffre and her lawyers of fabricating the claims for financial gain. This is a legal filing (likely a complaint or amended complaint) from a lawsuit (Case 1:19-cv-03377-LAP) filed by an unnamed plaintiff against Alan Dershowitz. The document alleges Dershowitz sexually assaulted the plaintiff when she was a minor and part of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation, and subsequently defamed her in a conspiracy with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to discredit her. This is a legal complaint filed by Virginia Giuffre against Alan Dershowitz, alleging defamation, battery, and violation of the Wiretap Act. The document details Dershowitz's alleged attempts to discredit Giuffre through false claims, secret recordings of settlement negotiations, and a narrative that she was part of an extortion plot. It also recounts the investigation that disproved Dershowitz's alibis regarding his association with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Plaintiff who alleges she was sex trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein and sexually abused by Alan Dershowitz between 2000-2002, beginning when she was 16. She is suing Dershowitz for sexual abuse and defamation.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Accused of defaming Virginia Giuffre, committing battery against her, and illegally recording confidential settlement negotiations. He is portrayed as attempting to discredit her claims and frame her allegations as part of an extortion plot.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as running a sex trafficking enterprise that abused the plaintiff and over 30 other minors. Pleaded guilty to procuring a minor for prostitution. Close friend and client of Alan Dershowitz.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Lawyer for Virginia Giuffre in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) proceeding. Sued Alan Dershowitz for defamation after Dershowitz attacked him and his co-counsel.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Former U.S. District Court judge and lawyer for Virginia Giuffre in the CVRA proceeding. Sued Alan Dershowitz for defamation alongside Brad Edwards.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Wealthy businessman (owner of Victoria's Secret) who is referenced by Alan Dershowitz as the target of an alleged extortion plot by Virginia Giuffre and her lawyers.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Lawyer referenced by Alan Dershowitz as allegedly pressuring accusers to make false accusations and being involved in an extortion plot. Dershowitz accuses him of subornation of perjury.

persons.name: Sarah Ransome
persons.context: Another alleged victim of Epstein's sex trafficking. The document states Epstein arranged for Dershowitz to represent her and lent her out to Dershowitz for sex, which Dershowitz denied.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused of recruiting the plaintiff into Epstein's sex trafficking operation. Described as a long-time procurer for Epstein and a co-conspirator with Dershowitz to discredit the plaintiff.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: A long-time Epstein employee who confirmed Dershowitz visited Epstein's Palm Beach home frequently, 4-5 times a year, and would stay for multiple days.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Worked for Epstein in Palm Beach and confirmed Dershowitz visited, that young women were present during his visits, and that Dershowitz was there when women came to give massages.

persons.name: Edwards
persons.context: Referenced as one of the plaintiff's former lawyers who previously brought a case against Epstein. Also referenced as having written to Dershowitz in 2011 about observations of Epstein with underage females.

persons.name: Cassell
persons.context: Referenced as one of the plaintiff's former lawyers who, along with Edwards, brought a case against Epstein that was settled.

persons.name: Kenneth W. Starr
persons.context: One of Epstein's lawyers who signed a letter to the New York Times downplaying the scope of Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: One of Epstein's lawyers who signed a letter to the New York Times downplaying the scope of Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: One of Epstein's lawyers who signed a letter to the New York Times downplaying the scope of Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: One of Epstein's lawyers who signed a letter to the New York Times downplaying the scope of Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Nathan Myhrvold
persons.context: Identified by Alan Dershowitz as the person Virginia Giuffre allegedly confused him with. Giuffre confirmed it was Dershowitz, not Myhrvold.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: One of Giuffre's former attorneys who, along with Paul Cassell, sued Dershowitz for defamation. They settled that case, and their public statement is referenced.

persons.name: Mr. Alessi
persons.context: Testified regarding the frequency of Alan Dershowitz's visits to Jeffrey Epstein's properties, contradicting Dershowitz's claims.

persons.name: Mr. Rodriguez
persons.context: Testified regarding the frequency of Alan Dershowitz's visits to Jeffrey Epstein's properties, contradicting Dershowitz's claims.

persons.name: Ms. Ransome
persons.context: Provided testimony that contradicted Alan Dershowitz's claims about his visits to Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Ms. Farmer
persons.context: Provided testimony that contradicted Alan Dershowitz's claims about his visits to Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Charles J. Cooper
persons.context: Attorney for Virginia Giuffre who signed this court filing.

connections.description: Dershowitz was Epstein's lawyer and is described as his 'close friend, and co-conspirator' in the sex trafficking scheme.
Giuffre alleges Dershowitz sexually abused her on numerous occasions between 2000-2002 when she was trafficked by Epstein.
Epstein sex trafficked and abused Giuffre, beginning when she was 16, and lent her out to others for sexual purposes.
Dershowitz publicly attacked Edwards, leading Edwards to sue Dershowitz for defamation. The suit was settled in April 2016.
Dershowitz publicly attacked Cassell, leading Cassell to sue Dershowitz for defamation alongside Brad Edwards.
Edwards represented Giuffre in the CVRA proceeding and filed a joinder motion on her behalf describing her abuse.
Cassell represented Giuffre in the CVRA proceeding alongside Brad Edwards.
Dershowitz accuses Boies of suborning perjury, orchestrating false accusations, and being part of an extortion plot.
Dershowitz claims Giuffre's accusations were part of a plot to extort money from Wexner, implying a connection between Wexner and the alleged scheme.
Described as close friends for many years. Dershowitz frequently traveled on Epstein's private plane and visited his various homes.
Accused of conspiring with Maxwell to discredit and silence the plaintiff as part of an effort to conceal sex trafficking crimes.
The document alleges Epstein arranged for Dershowitz to represent Sarah Ransome.
The document alleges Epstein "lent out" Ransome to Dershowitz for sex, which Dershowitz denied.
Maxwell is described as Epstein's long-time procurer and a co-conspirator in his sex trafficking enterprise.
Epstein sexually abused the plaintiff when she was under 18, trafficked her, and sent her to Thailand on an assignment.
The plaintiff alleges Dershowitz sexually assaulted her at Epstein's New York mansion when she was under 18.
Edwards, along with Paul Cassell, previously sued Dershowitz for defamation. That case was settled.
Dershowitz claimed Giuffre confused him with Myhrvold, a business colleague of Epstein. This claim was investigated and rejected.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Abuse of Giuffre
events.description: Virginia Giuffre alleges she was sexually abused by Alan Dershowitz on numerous occasions during this period, beginning when she was 16, as part of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking scheme.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested for sex trafficking. Alan Dershowitz defended him by attacking the truthfulness of his accusers.

events.title: CVRA Challenge Filed
events.description: A challenge to the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) was filed on behalf of two of Epstein's victims, alleging the NPA was concealed from victims in violation of the Crime Victims' Rights Act.

events.title: Giuffre Provides Information for CVRA Case
events.description: Virginia Giuffre provided information to lawyers in the CVRA case, discussing her sex trafficking by Epstein. Her lawyers filed a Joinder Motion describing her abuse, including by Alan Dershowitz.

events.title: Settlement of Defamation Suit
events.description: Alan Dershowitz settled the defamation claims brought against him by Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell. The financial terms were kept confidential.

events.title: Miami Herald Investigation Published
events.description: The Miami Herald published the first in a series of articles exposing how Epstein and his lawyers obtained the NPA, referring to Dershowitz's alleged sexual abuse of Giuffre.

events.title: Court Opinion in Jane Doe 1 and Jane Doe 2 v. United States
events.description: A court opinion stated that from about 1999 to 2007, Jeffrey Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls and directed others to abuse them, working in concert with others.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assault by Dershowitz
events.description: Plaintiff alleges Alan Dershowitz sexually assaulted her at Epstein's New York mansion (9 East 70th Street) when she was under 18, immediately after an incident of abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA)
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a Non-Prosecution Agreement with the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, avoiding federal prosecution for sex crimes and granting immunity to potential co-conspirators. The agreement was kept confidential from victims.

events.title: Jane Doe No. 1 CVRA Petition
events.description: A victim identified as Jane Doe No. 1 filed a petition to enforce her rights under the Crime Victims' Rights Act, alleging the government failed to confer with victims about Epstein's plea deal.

events.title: Court Finds CVRA Violation
events.description: A court granted summary judgment for victims, finding the government violated the Crime Victims' Rights Act by not disclosing the NPA and confirming Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls.

events.title: Dershowitz Public Accusation
events.description: Alan Dershowitz publicly accused his "false accusers" (including Sarah Ransome) of perjury and challenged them to sue him for defamation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody.

events.title: Confidential Settlement Negotiations
events.description: Alan Dershowitz requests confidential settlement negotiations with Virginia Giuffre's lawyers, David Boies, claiming Giuffre confused him with Nathan Myhrvold and providing a travel summary to support his alibi.

events.title: Dershowitz's Plea for Statement
events.description: Alan Dershowitz emails David Boies pleading for a mutually acceptable statement from Giuffre or her lawyer acknowledging the 'possibility' of mistaken identification, rather than claiming she was lying.

events.title: Settlement of Defamation Case
events.description: Alan Dershowitz settles the defamation case brought against him by Virginia Giuffre's then-lawyers, Bradley Edwards and Paul Cassell. Edwards and Cassell issue a public statement contradicting Dershowitz's claim of vindication.

events.title: Dershowitz Releases Statements to Press
events.description: Alan Dershowitz releases false and defamatory statements about Virginia Giuffre to the press, accusing her of perjury and extortion as part of a campaign to destroy her reputation.

events.title: Filing of Giuffre's Complaint
events.description: Virginia Giuffre files this complaint against Alan Dershowitz, alleging defamation, battery, and violation of the Wiretap Act.

locations: 9 East 70 Street, New York, New York 10021 (Epstein's New York mansion)
2 Tudor City Place Apt. 10EN, New York, New York 10017 (Alan Dershowitz's residence)
West Palm Beach, Florida (location of Epstein's mansion)
Palm Beach, Florida (location of Epstein's mansion and where abuse occurred)
Thailand (where Epstein sent the plaintiff on an assignment)
Australia (where the plaintiff fled to escape Epstein)
keyFacts: Virginia Giuffre alleges Alan Dershowitz sexually abused her on numerous occasions between 2000-2002 when she was a minor being trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein.
The complaint describes Dershowitz as Epstein's 'lawyer, close friend, and co-conspirator' and a participant in sex trafficking.

Dershowitz engaged in a extensive public campaign, from late 2018 through 2019, denying Giuffre's allegations and accusing her and her lawyers of fabricating the story for financial gain as part of an extortion plot against Leslie Wexner.
Dershowitz previously settled a defamation lawsuit brought against him by Giuffre's lawyers, Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell, in April 2016.
The complaint cites a 2019 court opinion stating Jeffrey Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls and worked in concert with others to obtain minors for sexual gratification.
The plaintiff alleges Alan Dershowitz sexually assaulted her at Epstein's New York mansion in late 2000 or early 2001 when she was under 18 years old.

The document accuses Dershowitz of engaging in a conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to defame and discredit the plaintiff in order to silence her and conceal sex trafficking crimes.
Witness testimony from Epstein employees Juan Alessi and Alfredo Rodriguez is cited to contradict Dershowitz's claims that he was never present at Epstein's properties when underage girls were there.
The 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement granted Epstein immunity from federal prosecution and also granted immunity to any potential co-conspirators, a fact kept confidential from victims.
The document references another alleged victim, Sarah Ransome, who claims Epstein arranged for Dershowitz to be her lawyer and that she was "lent out" to Dershowitz for sex.
Alan Dershowitz secretly recorded confidential settlement negotiations with Virginia Giuffre's lawyer, David Boies, without consent, a potential violation of federal and state wiretap laws.

An investigation into Dershowitz's alibi (including travel records and witness testimony from Epstein's staff) allegedly proved false his claims that he rarely visited Epstein's properties and could not have been involved.
Dershowitz initially argued that Giuffre had mistaken him for Nathan Myhrvold, but Giuffre confirmed upon seeing photos that it was Dershowitz.

Dershowitz settled a prior defamation lawsuit brought by Giuffre's former lawyers, Edwards and Cassell, but the terms were confidential, and those lawyers publicly stated his claims of vindication were misleading.

The complaint alleges Dershowitz's public campaign to brand Giuffre as a liar and extortionist was a malicious attempt to destroy her credibility and her nonprofit work helping sex trafficking victims.
